intro: Neoporteria megliolii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved neoporteria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements, it is appreciated by gardeners interested in native flora.
